posts.name: James Racadio
posts.cooked: Hello. Team 8086 is a week from competition. We are scaling down our efforts and just trying to get an auto programmed to shoot our note in the speaker. We have everything coded 100% operational for teleop, we just need to know how to code that to work in auto as well. Any help is greatly appreciated.
Is your codebase public? It is hard to give out applicable answers without being able to see your code.

posts.name: James Racadio
posts.cooked:

posts.cooked:

posts.name: James Racadio
posts.cooked: Thank you. We will try that today.

posts.name: James Racadio
posts.cooked: It worked! One issue, there is no button being pressed, so the “handleInterupt” does nothing and the motors keep spinning the entire 15 seconds. What would I change that to to stop the motors after 4 seconds?

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
Easiest option is to change the handleInterrupt to finallyDo .

From that documentation:

The finallyDo() ( Java , C++ ) decorator composes the command with an a lambda that will be called after the command’s end() method, with the same boolean parameter indicating whether the command finished or was interrupted.

The handleInterrupt() ( Java , C++ ) decorator composes the command with an a lambda that will be called only when the command is interrupted.
